document.docAuthor: Almeida-Silva, Lina M., Griswold, Charles E. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Pandava shiva Almeida-Silva, Griswold & Brescovit, 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Asian spider genus Pandava Lehtinen (Araneae: Titanoecidae): description of five new species and first record of Titanoecidae from Africa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Asian spider genus Pandava Lehtinen (Araneae: Titanoecidae): description of five new species and first record of Titanoecidae from Africa

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 58 – 63. Pandava shiva sp. nov., ♂ (CASENT 9032827, India). 58. DTA from male right palp, dorsal view; 59. Ditto, anterior view; 60. Ditto, prolateral view; 61. Male right palp bulb, ventral view; 62. Ditto frontal view; 63. Ditto retrolateral view. Abbreviations: CB—Cymbium; E—Embolus; MLT—Median lobe of tibial apophysis; PLT— Prolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; RLT—Retrolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; ST—Subtegulum; T—Tegulum; TF— Tegular furrow.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 64 – 69. Pandava shiva sp. nov., ♂ and Ψ (CASENT 9032827, India; CASENT 9032826; Pakistan). 64. Female chelicerae, retrolateral view; 65. Ditto, detail of stridulatory setae; 66. Female left palpal femur, prolateral view; 67. Ditto, detail of stridulatory files; 68. Male right palpal femur, prolateral view; 69. Ditto, detail of stridulatory file.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURES 70 – 74. Pandava shiva sp. nov. ♂ and Ψ (CASENT 9032827, 9032826, India and Pakistan). 70. Male left palp, dorsal view; 71. Ditto, retrolateral view; 72. Ditto, ventral view; 73. Epigynum, ventral view; 74. Vulva, dorsal view. Abbreviations: CB—Cymbium; CD—Copulatory duct; CF—Cymbial furrow; CO—Copulatory openings; E— Embolus; ER—Epigynal rim; FD—Fertilization duct; MF—Median field; MLT—Median lobe of tibial apophysis; PLT—Prolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; RLT—Retrolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; S—Spermathecae; SD—Sinuous depression; ST—Subtegulum; TF—Tegular furrow; TP—Tegular process.
figureCitation.captionText-3: FIGURES 75 – 77. Pandava shiva sp. nov. Ψ (CASENT 9032826, Pakistan). 75. Vulva, dorsal view; 76. Ditto, left spermatheca and copulatory duct; 77. Ditto, right spermatheca lateral view. Primary pore indicated by black circles. Abbreviations: CD—Copulatory duct; FD—Fertilization duct; S—Spermathecae.
figureCitation.captionText-4: FIGURES 78 – 83. Pandava shiva sp. nov., Ψ, (CASENT 9032826, Pakistan). 78. Spinnerets, posterior overview; 79. Left spinnerets; 80. Cribellate spigots; 81. Anterior lateral spinneret, left; 82. Posterior median spinneret, left; 83. Posterior lateral spinneret, right. Abbreviations: AC—Aciniform gland spigot; ALS—Anterior lateral spinnerets; CY— Cylindrical gland spigot; MAP—Major ampullate gland spigot; mAP—Minor ampullate gland spigot; PC—Paracribellar gland spigot; PI—Piriform gland spigot; PLS—Posterior lateral spinnerets; PMS—Posterior median spinnerets.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype male and paratype female from Rajasthan, Keoladeonati park, India ,
3-5 .XII. 1989
, V. and B. Roth, deposited in CAS (CASENT 9032827 and 9032830 , respectively). Paratype female from 4 mi Northwest of Kharian (elev. 350m ), W Pakistan ,
14 .XII. 1961
, E. S. Ross & D. Q. Cavagnaro, deposited in IBSP ( 156973 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 53–57.
Pandava hunanensis
♂ and Ψ, (paratypes, Hunan). 53. Male left palp, dorsal view; 54. Ditto, retrolateral view; 55. Ditto, ventral view; 56. Female epigynum, ventral view; 57. Vulva, dorsal view. Abbreviations: CB—Cymbium; CD—Copulatory duct; CO—Copulatory opening; E—Embolus; ER—Epigynal rim; FD—Fertilization duct; MA—Median apophysis; MLT—Median lobe of tibial apophysis; PLT—Prolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; RLT— Retrolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; S—Spermathecae; SD—Sinuous depression; ST—Subtegulum; TP—Tegular process.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific epithet is a noun in apposition referring to the Hindu God Shiva , which means the “Auspicious one” in Sanskrit.

Diagnosis.
Pandava shiva
differs from
P. hunanensis
in the more anteriorly curved PLT (
Figs. 58 –60
,
70, 72
); MLT with enlarged base and hyaline plate with five projections (
Figs. 58 –60
, 70 ); median apophysis absent (
Figs. 61–63
) on the male palp; epigynum with short distance between the epigynal rims (
Fig. 73
) and posterior border of median field pointed (
Fig. 73
) in the female.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 58–63.
Pandava shiva
sp. nov.
, ♂ (CASENT 9032827, India). 58. DTA from male right palp, dorsal view; 59. Ditto, anterior view; 60. Ditto, prolateral view; 61. Male right palp bulb, ventral view; 62. Ditto frontal view; 63. Ditto retrolateral view. Abbreviations: CB—Cymbium; E—Embolus; MLT—Median lobe of tibial apophysis; PLT— Prolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; RLT—Retrolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; ST—Subtegulum; T—Tegulum; TF— Tegular furrow.

FIGURES 64–69.
Pandava shiva
sp. nov.
, ♂ and Ψ (CASENT 9032827, India; CASENT 9032826; Pakistan). 64. Female chelicerae, retrolateral view; 65. Ditto, detail of stridulatory setae; 66. Female left palpal femur, prolateral view; 67. Ditto, detail of stridulatory files; 68. Male right palpal femur, prolateral view; 69. Ditto, detail of stridulatory file.

FIGURES 70–74.
Pandava shiva
sp. nov.
♂ and Ψ (CASENT 9032827, 9032826, India and Pakistan). 70. Male left palp, dorsal view; 71. Ditto, retrolateral view; 72. Ditto, ventral view; 73. Epigynum, ventral view; 74. Vulva, dorsal view. Abbreviations: CB—Cymbium; CD—Copulatory duct; CF—Cymbial furrow; CO—Copulatory openings; E— Embolus; ER—Epigynal rim; FD—Fertilization duct; MF—Median field; MLT—Median lobe of tibial apophysis; PLT—Prolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; RLT—Retrolateral lobe of tibial apophysis; S—Spermathecae; SD—Sinuous depression; ST—Subtegulum; TF—Tegular furrow; TP—Tegular process.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional material examined. PAKISTAN .
West Pakistan ,
4 mi northwest Kharian (elev. 350m ),
14 .XII. 1961
, E. S. Ross and D. Q. Cavagnaro (CASENT 9032826, 9 Ψ, 2 immatures; IBSP 156974, 2Ψ).
